rule: The chosen category for classification must be clearly representational and consistent with the core subject matter of the input text as it fits within the provided category definitions.
input: World Health Organization warns of new pandemic threats
output:
Category: World

This headline discusses a warning from the World Health Organization related to potential pandemic threats and thus fits under the "World" category.
complianceText:
The output provides a classification of the input text, labeling it as "Category: World." According to the chatbot description, a news article should be classified into one of the categories: World, Sports, Business, or Sci/Tech. The output matches one of these categories, "World." 

The additional commentary explaining why it fits under the "World" category discusses the topic of a warning from the World Health Organization related to potential pandemic threats, which is typically a global concern falling under the "World" category in news classifications. Since the output does not infringe any explicit rules provided in the description and provides a category from the predefined list, the output complies with the description.

No violation.
OK
